channel.title: Player Updating Renders Player Unclickable
channel.description:
Hello everyone.
I'm working on a RS2 Framework right now, but I have just found a very annoying glitch that I can't put my finger on, so I was wondering if this had happened to anyone before and they have any tips.
When i'm updating my players so they can see each other, the last player to login can not be right clicked. In a better example, let's say CharacterA logs in, and afterwards, CharacterB logs in. CharacterA can right click CharacterB, but CharacterB can't right click CharacterA.
Any tips?
EDIT: Resolved it by figuring out that if a players ID is 0 the player would be unclickable. Made all IDs +1 and it worked perfect.

item.title: Player Updating Renders Player Unclickable
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

Hello everyone.

I’m working on a RS2 Framework right now, but I have just found a very annoying glitch that I can’t put my finger on, so I was wondering if this had happened to anyone before and they have any tips.

When i’m updating my players so they can see each other, the last player to login can not be right clicked. In a better example, let’s say CharacterA logs in, and afterwards, CharacterB logs in. CharacterA can right click CharacterB, but CharacterB can’t right click CharacterA.

Any tips?

EDIT: Resolved it by figuring out that if a players ID is 0 the player would be unclickable. Made all IDs +1 and it worked perfect.
